newsitem.title: USA: Dr Solomon's files secondary share offer.
newsitem.headline: Dr Solomon's files secondary share offer.

text.p: Dr Solomon' Group Plc filed Wednesday with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to register up to 3.5 million American Depositary shares representing 10.5 million ordinary shares, all of which are being sold by a group of shareholders including company managers.
Underwriters for the offering, Goldman, Sachs & Co., Hambrecht & Quist and Robertson, Stephens & Co, have an over-allotment option of up to 210,000 depositary shares.
The company, with headquarters, in Buckinghamshire, England, develops, markets and supports anti-virus computer software programs.
In February 1996, three senior executives of the company, Geoffrey Leary, David Stephens and Keith Perret, organized a managment buyout of the company.
After the planned sale their collective holdings in the company will be reduced to about 49.8 percent from about 69.1 percent, according to the SEC filing.
